oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Validation of a prototype cow-side instrument for the measurement of blood ionized calcium concentrations in dairy cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Neves, R. C.
Stokol, T.
Curler, M. D.
Thomas, M. J.
McArt, J. A. A.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: field measurement
blood calcium
ionized
instrument
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: There is currently no efficient and inexpensive method for field measurement of blood calcium concentrations. Ionized calcium (iCa) is the homeostatic form of the mineral and is thought to have greater biological relevance over that of total calcium. The objective of this study was to evaluate the linearity and precision of a prototype cow-side instrument (Horiba, Japan) for measuring blood iCa concentrations.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2015; 210
